title: segmentation violation on interrupt
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `1.9.10-stable`
OS & Version: Ubuntu 18.04.3
Commit hash : 58cf5686eab9019cc01e202e846a6bbc70a3301d

#### Expected behaviour
expected graceful shutdown on keyboard interrupt

#### Actual behaviour

segmentation violation
```
INFO [01-21|01:07:26.843] Got interrupt, shutting down... 
INFO [01-21|01:07:27.044] Imported new state entries               count=366  elapsed=1.227ms      processed=63737646 pending=8865  retry=0   duplicate=139 unexpected=1055
INFO [01-21|01:07:27.058] IPC endpoint closed                      url=/home/USER/.ethereum/geth.ipc
INFO [01-21|01:07:27.249] Blockchain manager stopped 
INFO [01-21|01:07:27.289] Stopping Ethereum protocol 
INFO [01-21|01:07:27.332] Ethereum protocol stopped 
INFO [01-21|01:07:27.332] Transaction pool stopped 
panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
[signal SIGSEGV: segmentation violation code=0x1 addr=0x0 pc=0x957723]
```
#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
not reproducible to my knowledge

I can confirm the same issue with geth 1.9.10-stable on macOS 10.15.2.

I can confirm the same issue with geth 1.9.10 on Windows 10 (`geth-windows-amd64-1.9.10-58cf5686.zip`). Happens every time I press Ctrl-C within the `cmd.exe` window. `geth.exe` was started with `--syncmode fast`. Never fully syncs, always around 100 blocks missing.

Still happens with geth 1.9.11 on Windows 10 (`geth-windows-amd64-1.9.11-6a62fe39.zip`).
